availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William J. Lay (Union County, Tennessee, farmer)

body.p: Union County, Tennessee, farmer. Tennessee native. Son of William Lay and Sarah Lay. Married to Hester Ann Lay. Father of Elbert Lay and Marion Lay. Resident in Grainger County, Tennessee, in 1850. Farmer in Union County in 1860. Employed William Kitts in Union County, Tennessee, in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Union County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Grainger County, District 13, p. 117A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Union County, District 1, p. 425.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Tennessee, Union County, District, p. 2 of 2 on microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Find A Grave, "William J. Lay (Aug. 25. 1829-Aug. 1, 1906)," Memorial #43291285, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/43291285 (accessed January 31, 2020).
